title: Document the customization  of the minikube.yml and openshift.yaml
body:
### Describe the bug

With the target=kubernetes, if we put a kubernetes.yml inside src/main/kubernetes , in the generation process this contents will be added to the kubernetes.yml inside target/kubernetes along with the auto generated resources.

In the documentation is not said that the file to customize this for minikube needs to be minikube.yml, and the same for openshift that needs to be openshift.yml
https://quarkus.io/guides/deploying-to-kubernetes#using-existing-resources

### Expected behavior

Documentation says that for each extension the configuration file is the name of the extension

### Actual behavior

It only mentions the kubernetes extension case

### How to Reproduce?

Add a src/main/kubernetes/kubernetes.yml and set quarkus.kubernetes.target=minikube and check that the content of that src file is not in the target/kubernetes/minikube.yml
